pullRequest.body:
Add a lemma about the identity map of the zero module.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop *Formalizing algebraic geometry* in June 2024.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3d4048bc20](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14922/commits/3d4048bc2028fdbf526ade82e9d4b9f69ca8d641)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ identityMapOfZeroModuleIsZero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

:v: matematiflo can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

bors r-

What do you think about adding the `simp` tag?
Canceled.
bors r+
bors r-
Canceled.

@matematiflo don't worry if you are confused about `git`, but:
* the `simp` isn't added, I don't know whether you forgot to push or you messed up something in trying to apply my suggestion.
* in general, even if you get a delegation, please wait for CI (in practice wait for all the checks to be green) before merging.

But again, don't worry, the first time the process is a little confusing!
Note that since I `bors r-`, one check will stay red (this is a bug in github in my opinion). You can safely ignore that. But all the other checks should be green.
bors r+

> bors r+

![immagine](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0672db17-b073-4ba8-aa55-c9551b34f1c3)
You should wait for the yellow thing here to become green. :D

The rationale is the following: when you merge it, a bot will start working, but not only on your PR, it creates batches of several PRs at the same time. If your PR has a problem the whole batch will fail, and everybody will loose some time (nothing serious!). This is why we ask author to "wait for CI": this means that another bot has checked that your PR is OK.

bors r-
Canceled.
Anyway this means that our instructions are not clear, it's surely not your fault.

For example I suspect that a linter will complain saying that `simp can prove this, so it cannot be simp`. Of course this means that my suggestion wasn't accurate, but I am just lazy to test it by myself.

OK. What threw me off is the message from 1h ago saying "‚úåÔ∏è matematiflo can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with bors r+. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests)." I simply tried to follow that instruction.

Yeah, that message is not accurate. I don't know whether it depends on us or on the bot. Let me stress that this is not a problem at all, even if you try to merge something that does not work at end, the worst can happen is that a computer waist some time, you cannot break mathlib.
I checked again and `simp` cannot solve this, so we're safe on that front. As for the rest of the merging process, I am available if further actions are required on my end.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10015252883/job/27686364674)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10015252883/job/27686364551)

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+
Add `@[simp]` attribute. Will try `bors r+` again next.

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem identityMapOfZeroModuleIsZero [Subsingleton M] : id (R := R‚ÇÅ) (M := M) = 0 :=
```
Done! Thanks üëçüèª

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Algebra/Module/LinearMap/Defs): the identity map of the zero module is the zero map
